caption: Great food for the price!!  They really care about their customers ! Would recommend

Was worried about getting food here because of the reviews but I just had beef & broccoli, general tso’s chicken and shrimp fried rice & egg rolls and they were all pretty good! I’ll come back for takeouts for sure.

Ignore the spoiled NIMBY reviews in here expecting a Michelin Star experience from a tiny shop. This is a really good hole in the wall place. The lunch prices are fantastic, I go here ~3 times a week and have no regrets.
4.5 the food is tasty and delivery is prompt. The lunch specials are a great bargain and why I started ordering from here.

This place has the absolutely BEST Singapore Noodles in the DMV. I like mine extra spicy and they do not disappoints. Their egg rolls are great and they always taste fresh and not overly fried. I haven’t try many items because those two are my go to, but I doubt it will disappoint. I love this place. As I’m writing this I’m thinking on the food and I’m thinking I should order.
Legit the worst takeout food I’ve ever attempted to eat. I tossed both meals in the trash. I wouldn’t wish this take out food on my worst enemy.

out of town-ers beware, you are likely to be disappointed, as you are with everything.  listen, coming to DC and expecting things to be better than they were back home is a ridiculous expectation.  These ppl grind, the way many services do in largely populated cities.  don’t expect a James Beard or Michelin rated spot when you’re ordering carry-out, and do not (I REPEAT) do not think that by you being lazy and ordering your food from a 3rd-party player delivery service is going to meet your expectations of “good food”.  get yourself up and go in to order your carry-out.  you’re likely coming to this spot bc you’re drunk, high, or a combo.  your judgement is already predisposed to bias.  reflect on your own personal decisions  which guided you to seek out this food tell the tale of your reviews.  5 outta 5 would bust this move again.  ALSO- Vegan options....
These they make good food.
Absolute fire

Honestly, one of the worst carry-outs - Chinese "restaurants" that I've had. I wouldn't normally review a carry-out, but this place was just insulting. Not with the service, but with the food. I ordered a half a Peking duck (you know.. What they're named after), and literally got about a drumsticks worth of actual meat. The rest was pure fat and gristle.  And I really got the feeling that it was sitting in the back somewhere and was simply warmed up. I love duck, and it doesn't take much to satisfy me, but that was just awful.  Lastly, (and here's the offensive part) I ordered chicken fried basil rice. The rice would have been decent/good if it was mixed with chicken. Because.. THAT... Was not chicken. Nor was it pork, or seafood (although it had the consistency of bad calamari).  I tried to ignore the fact that the rice didn't even have any remnants of chicken flavor, but... I couldn't.  That was just gross.  I won't speculate as to what type of meat that was.... But I'm pretty sure whatever it was "had" whiskers. Honestly, I wouldn't even bother ordering an egg roll from there.  My experience was that bad.  Order from there at your own discretion.
Wings. Fries. Mumbo sauce. Don't over think it people
They charged my credit card twice not good

NO STAR IT ALL !!! TRASH FOOD !!! DIRTY VERY DIRTY SMELL !! SUPER GREASE !! THEY SHOULD BE CHECKED BY THE FOOD  ORGANISATION IT S A DANGEROUS RESTAURANT NOT HEALTHY IT ALL !!! The worst place ever !!!! I order food from my hotel and ask for some spicy sauce as well when I arrive in the room no spicy sauce and the food was so grease and oil coming out from the food so much it was not good it all !! My worst Chinese food ever ever !! And they are not a good customer service !! Big mistake ever ... if I could send u pic o would u will be as chocked as me with this food !!! Which o don’t name food actually 😡😡😡🤬🤬  TRASH TRASH FOOD !!!!

If I could give this food zero stars, I would. I had the Ma Po Tofu, the tofu was flavourless and the sauce was slimy. One of my friends had the chicken chow mien, the chicken had no taste and the sauce had the consistency of saliva but with less flavour. Another had the chicken pad Thai which was good if you like bland food with only one singular flavour. After spending over $160 with my group of friends we were left disappointed and hungry as we could not fathom eating any more of the food. Please please please, I beg, don’t eat from Peking Garden unless you want to be thoroughly disappointed 😢
Food quality was pretty bad for the price. I wouldn't  recommend it.
Great Chinese food

Let's just start off by saying that if I could give them -1,000,000 stars they would have it because their service or should've been service was absolutely terrible me and my roommate attend Howard University and have yet to receive any food we call the lady about three times only for her to rush us off the phone and tell her she can't help us. The food has already been paid for so we just want our food.  We received an email saying that they can't reach us however the phone number is attached to the GrubHub account and the GrubHub account that you notice since is the number to the restaurant so I don't know was going on. All that I have left to say is we will never ever ever ever  this lifetime eat there again !  I advise anyone else looking for cheap Chinese restaurant to eat to never spend your money at this place you will be disappointed disrespected and hungry.

I cannot attest to their delivery as I always pick up my food in shop but I enjoy this place because of the large portions, quick service, and the food tastes pretty good for the price you pay. I am a vegetarian and their vegetarian meat options are pretty good. I got the vegetarian lo mein, orange chicken, and sesame chicken.
Great local place for take out or delivery. My go-to for Chinese food in the area for 11 years.
Absolutely the WORST!!!!

The servings are apparently large, but for one person they would not do half and half, so I was expected to buy $24 worth of food for 1 person. Also the women at the counter seemed to have an attitude. They don't seem particularly interested in running a successful business for some reason. I left.
Hole in the wall Chinese place at its finest. It's all fresh cooked. While some orders may have been messed up, I've ordered the exact same thing maybe 12x, with no complaints.
Steamed meat dumplings are amazing!!! Recommend you pick it up as delivery can sometimes take a while.
dirty!
Trash food
Bad Food!
Trash!

I would give less than a star if I could. My food took 2 hours to get to me, it was cold, crab Rangoon was soggy, chicken was too tough to eat and when I called to complain the manager he was rude and refused to refund even half my money! Terrible business!

Have been getting takeout from Peking Garden for about four years. Always friendly over the phone and consistent delivery times. The food is reliably good. The vegetarian (TVP) options are a viable alternative to the meat menu.
Friendly staff, but buyer beware-- if you pay for cheap fastfood, you'll get cheap fastfood.  That said, in a pinch, it's passable.
The general tso taste like it's been smothered in mambo sauce. Blegh.

Tell me if I'm wrong:  I'm simply trying to figure out if I'm wrong for making a order and got rushed through the whole process and the person on the phone was getting mad about it.  I just wanted to understand him and tell him my address for about he 3rd time but he couldn't get it right. I was cool about it and didn't think any ill of it.  Then I get my food about an hour and forty-five late, warm and the rice wasn't rice.  I had ordered fried rice but I got brown. Also to mention when I called in to check in on the hour. They was kissed at me for checking in.  So I called them back and told him he messed up my order, told him it was cold and I just want my fried rice delivered.  He had the never to tell me that he wasn't going to do it and got loud and disrespectful with me for stating a customer service error on  his end. After I got tired of the disresepect. I've told him that he shouldn't be talking with me because I was being civil and level head and talking to me like that isn't a good look.  He continued to talk very wreckers to the point that I wished I could of snatched him through the phone and smack him.  So now we found a solution... he said he could deliver it and guess what he said what had to be done to get my rice? A delivery fee.  Food cold, Arrived late and the order was messed up.  How am I the bad person in this situation?  So after I told him that wasn't an option and something has to be done. He then turns around and say. If I pull up the place it's now $5 flat to get some rice.  You F'n kidding me right?  WOW!  Food was aight 2.8/5 Service 0.3/5  Would I recommend another person to this place I've been getting from for over 2 years.  F no! Not a chance!  That be the last time you run your mouth in a disrespectful manner and think my services is needed. From your end it's really not but for me.  You just lost me.  Sincerely yours! The guy from up the block!
I wish they'd put chow mein in my shrimp chow mein...
delicious and cheap,
I carry-out here quite a bit. The service has always been fine and more than fast. I wouldn't call this the best Chinese in town... but it works for an average night.

I spent 40.00 on the worst food ever. My shrimp unedible and the French fries were even worse they were soaked in oil and cold as a visitor to DC I recommend to any other visitor to stay far away from this place. I ordered the Peking duck and a 21 piece shrimp that only has 16 pieces. And Peking Duck usually  comes with a Asian style pancake not a flour tortilla that was dry and hard save your money and go somewhere else and definitely don't order to go. Worst place ever.
I walked in quite hungry. they recommended to me "Chef's Special #50 - General Tso's Chicken". It came with white rice. the whole portion was quite large. I enjoyed it.

As far as portions go, they are well sized -- from my experience they are light on side vegetables on meat plates and  heavy on vegetables and light on meat on mixed dishes.  For 2 main dishes and 2 sides, my bill quickly escalated to 45 dollars (including delivery/tip) on seamless -- so not necessarily the cheapest chinese food in town, but the food wasnt bad.
Terrible service. If you like being yelled at while ordering go ahead

Restaurant is in Washington, DC; one of the most popular business destinations in the world.  American Express; one of the most widely used corporate cards in the world.  Yet, the restaurant doesn't take American Express.  Too bad.  Lost my business.
Ordered from the at least three times my hubby would get pepper steak  etc noticed the dishes would have at a whole onion on top not to mention the green peppers (fillers)
